page.title: 06WRINGTON VALE RAILWAY
page.content: { WRINGTON VALE LIGHT RAILWAY}STARTED IN 1897,AND THE LAST TRAIN RAN ON JUNE 7,1963. THE OLD STATION AT BLAGDON CAN STILL BE SEEN NEXT TO THE RESERVOIR. IT IS NOW A PRIVATE HOUSE.THE PLATFORM IS STILL THERE AND YOU CAN SEE THE OLD LIGHTS AND THE WAITING ROOM. AT BURRINGTON YOU CAN SEE THE STATION MASTER'S HOUSE AND NEXT TO THAT THE OLD RAILWAY BRIDGE. THE STATION HAS GONE COMPLETELY BUT YOU CAN SEE WHERE THE TRACK TURNS A CORNER. IF YOU GO UNDER THE BRIDGE YOU CAN STILL SEE THE SMOKE MARKS ON THE ROOF. THE NEARBY BRIDGE THAT THE TRAINS WENT OVER WAS BUILT IN ABOUT 1860. THE RAILWAY WAS USED TO CARRY FREIGHT SUCH AS MILK AND CATTLE BUT IT ALSO CARRIED PEOPLE, PARTICULARLY DAYTRIPPERS.IT WAS CLOSED DOWN IN 1963 WHEN IT BECAME TOO EXPENSIVE TO RUN.
